intro: Eriosema albogriseum, commonly known as the white-hairy eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features soft, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance, and its flowers are typically small and pale in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
